page.title: 13THE BROMYARD HEALTH SERVICE
page.content: {Bromyard Hospital,}situated about one mile north of Bromyard, was originally a workhouse. Patients are old and difficult to care for. There are{two female wards and{one male ward,}named after local places. The hospital has{63 beds.}Two are G.P. beds which are reserved for the doctors' patients. There are a few day patients. There are 19 fully trained staff at the hospital. Two consultants from{Hereford}go to the hospital on Tuesdays. The{Day Hospital}is open two days a week. Patients travel from an 8_mile radius. An auxiliary nurse, a physiotherapist, a staff nurse, and an occupational therapist are employed. The hospital has no casualty department. In{1988}the new{Community {Hospital}will be built and the present hospital will close.
